alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:43PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central La Paz and Maricopa Counties through 630 PM MST... At 543 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Gladden, or 29 miles northwest of Tonopah, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wenden and Salome. This includes US Highway 60 between mile markers 55 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Tonopah Desert
